item.title: Building a motion rig for Sim-racing
item.description: What is Sim-racing? Sim-racing is short for “simulated racing”. Basically it means you are using racing simulator software to try and simulate real world racing as accurately as possible. This includes all the real-world variables such as fuel usage, damage to the car, tire wear, grip, suspension settings, etc., which is unlike the more well-known arcade racing games like Forza Motorsport or Gran Turismo. The goal is to provide the most realistic depiction of real world racing as much as possible.
